Package aom.scripting.xs.tr

Enum TriggerParamType

Object
Enum<TriggerParamType>
TriggerParamType
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<TriggerParamType>, Constable
public enum TriggerParamType
extends Enum<TriggerParamType>
This is an enumeration of all parameter types a trigger can use as input.
Author:
Mythic_Freak - mythic.freak[a]gmail.com

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class Enum

    Enum Constant Description
    ALLIANCE

    A "select area" style button.

    An input box for strings.

    A drop down list of UI categories.

  • Enum Constant Details

    • LONG

      public static final TriggerParamType LONG
      An input box for integers.
      Example
      -1

    • FLOAT

      public static final TriggerParamType FLOAT
      An input box for floats.
      Example
      -1.0

    • STRING

      public static final TriggerParamType STRING
      An input box for strings.
      Example
      default

    • STRINGID

      public static final TriggerParamType STRINGID
      Seems to be the same as string, but it may have internal differences.
      Example
      default

    • BOOL

      public static final TriggerParamType BOOL
      A button that can be switched ON or OFF. Returns either true or false.

    • UNIT

      public static final TriggerParamType UNIT
      A "select unit" style button that returns the name of the selected unit.
      Example
      5

    • GROUP

      public static final TriggerParamType GROUP
      Army selection tools.
      Example
      1,10 (player 1, army 11)

    • AREA

      public static final TriggerParamType AREA
      A "select area" style button.
      Example
      0, 0, 0

    • SOUND

      public static final TriggerParamType SOUND
      Select sound style tools.
      Note
      Yes, that's a correct example. The 1 seems to be unused.
      Example
      music_file","1

    • CAMERAINFO

      public static final TriggerParamType CAMERAINFO
      A set of "Set Cut" style buttons. Returns 4 vectors (position, direction, up, right) that exactly define the current camera position.

    • CAMTRACK

      public static final TriggerParamType CAMTRACK
      A drop down list of camera tracks.
      Example
      My_Camera_Track

    • OPERATOR

      public static final TriggerParamType OPERATOR
      A drop down list of operators. Two sets are available:
      • >
      • >=
      • ==
      • <=
      • <
      or
      • +
      • -
      • *
      • /
      The choice of set is decided by the default value you enter.

    • PLAYER

      public static final TriggerParamType PLAYER
      A drop down list of player numbers. Does not contain player 11 and 12. Therefore, you better use LONG to choose a player.
      Example
      1

    • TECH

      public static final TriggerParamType TECH
      A drop down list of technologies.
      See Also:
      Technology Constants in AI Reference.
      Example
      123

    • PROTOUNIT

      public static final TriggerParamType PROTOUNIT
      A drop down list of different unit types.
      Example
      Villager Greek

    • ALLIANCE

      public static final TriggerParamType ALLIANCE
      A drop down list of diplomacy settings. Returns either Ally, Neutral or Enemy.

    • KBSTAT

      public static final TriggerParamType KBSTAT
      A drop down list of statistics. Complete List:
      1. Tribute Received
      2. Tribute Sent
      3. Enemy Units Killed
      4. Enemy Builings Killed
      5. Units Killed Cost
      6. Buildings Killed Cost
      7. Units Lost
      8. Builings Lost
      9. Units Lost Cost
      10. Buildings Lost Cost
      11. Map Explored
      12. Trade Profit
      13. MIlitary Count
      14. Research Count Complete
      15. Research Total Cost
      16. Wonder Time
      17. Raw Score
      18. Relic High
      19. Economic Unit High
      20. Settlement High
      Example
      0

    • GODPOWER

      public static final TriggerParamType GODPOWER
      A drop down list of god powers.
      Example
      Reverse Time

    • RESOURCE

      public static final TriggerParamType RESOURCE
      A drop down list of resources. Returns either food, wood, gold or favor.

    • EVENT

      public static final TriggerParamType EVENT
      A drop down list of triggers.

      Does not allow selection of the current trigger.

      When a trigger is chosen in the drop-down list, an event ID is generated for it, which is the value of this parameter.

      Example
      0

    • TECHSTATUS

      public static final TriggerParamType TECHSTATUS
      A drop down list of possible technology statuses.
      See Also:
      Technology Status Constants in AI Reference.
      Example
      1

    • UNITSTANCE

      public static final TriggerParamType UNITSTANCE
      A drop down list of unit stances. Returns either Aggressive, Defensive or Passive.

    • UICATEGORY

      public static final TriggerParamType UICATEGORY
      A drop down list of UI categories. Complete List:
      1. market
      2. market2
      3. setgather
      4. cleargather
      5. eject
      6. garrison
      7. transform
      8. stance1
      9. stance2
      10. stance3

      21. CombatOff
      22. Formation1
      23. Formation2
      24. Formation3
      25. Formation4
      26. Delete
      27. Stop
      28. Unbuild
      29. Unbuild2
      30. SummonWorkers
      Example
      1

      public static final TriggerParamType PUFIELD

      2. Speed
      3. LOS

      5. Build Points

  • Method Details

    • values

      public static TriggerParamType[] values()
      Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared.
      Returns:
      an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

    • valueOf

      public static TriggerParamType valueOf​(String name)
      Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the enum constant to be returned.
      Returns:
      the enum constant with the specified name
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if this enum type has no constant with the specified name
      NullPointerException - if the argument is null
